title: Noam Chomsky - 1991-XX-XX - with Gore Vidal. Joint Interview After the Gulf War.
description:
Be sure to pick 720p for best sound and video.
Gore Vidal sat down for a joint interview with Noam Chomsky in 1991.  They have a lively discussion about the then recent Gulf War, media, education, etc.


I improved the sound somewhat by EQing it and removing much of the background hiss/hum, but the poor quality of the initial recording greatly limited what was possible.  The original mix was a very wide stereo, which I found very distracting, so I made it mono. 



The video was color-corrected and contrast improved, too.
As always, this was uploaded in ALAC lossless audio format.


Tags:


Chomsky, 1991, Noam Chomsky, Gore Vidal, George H.W. Bush, Iraq, Kuwait, S&L Bailout, Grenada, Operation Desert Storm, Norega, Saddam Hussein, Kurds, Ronald Reagan, media, oil, United Nations, Korea, HL Mencken, Permanent War Economy, USSR, Communism, propaganda, George Ball,
